S.FORM: bulabulay mun. patagilji anga.
gacalju! kicungalu!
bulabulay sun sinsi.
qiladju.
bulabulay mun a mapuljat. tucu a qadaw uri temulu a sinsi tjanumun tua anemaya a sepayuan a caucau nu qivu tua kakesain.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的排灣語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Paiwan language for food.

S.FORM: pucucug mun tua kai nua sinsi?
S.TRANSL: Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi, ini ku pucug. maqati sun a qivu a puita?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: inika ken a namakalangda, maqati sun a tjamezangal anan a pagalju?
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: pacunu a pasamaza! kicualu tjanuaken a semupu a puita.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.

S.FORM: bulai aravac a su sinupuan.
supu anga a puita. papezangalu anan.
S.TRANSL: Read it again. Please speak louder.

S.FORM: kainepetju. maya quriyaw.
patjekacauanu a su sapitj.
uii, sinsi.
patjekacauanu a su inpic.
sinsi, namadraudraw aken a masi inpic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: patjekacauanu a su siulaulaw.
sinsi, namadraudraw a ku siulaulaw.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: kisedjamun tua siulaulaw nua i ljaqedi a su salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: pasedjami aken tua su siulaulaw uii?
patjezuanga itjen tatja kitulu.
patjemaza a tja kitulu tucu, ucevucevungi anga nu tjaivililj a niciu.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: tima sun?
ti Kapi aken.
tima sun?
aljak aken ni Kuliw, ti Kapi a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Kuliw, and my name is Kapi.

S.FORM: timasun?
situ aken ni Camak, ti Giyu aken.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Camak, my name is Giyu.

S.FORM: tima a su ngadan?
a ku ngadan ti Mulaneng.
tima ngadan nua su kama?
ti Kuliw a ngada nua ku kama.
tima ti madju?
ti Tjukadr timadju.
ku kaka tjavulu timadju, ti Tjukadr timadju.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Tjukadr.

S.FORM: tima a ngada nimadju?
ti Kuljelje timadju.
ti Kuljelje timadju?
uii, ti Kuljelje timadju.
ti Api a ngadan nimadju?
ini, ti Puljaljuyan a ngadan nimadju.
tima azua?
ti Umi azua. ku kina timadju.
tima azua?
ku drava timadju, ti Madraw timadju.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Madraw。
She is my friend and her name is Madraw.

S.FORM: pida anga su cavilj tucu?
tucu a cavilj tapuljuq anga ku cavilj.
pida anga cavilj nimadju tucu?
izua tapuljuq saka drusa a cavilj nimadju tucu.
pidanga a cavilj nua su kama tucu?
lima puluq anga cavilj nua ku kama tucu.
izua mapida a marka su kaka?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: izua madrusa a ku kaka tjavulu, izua macidilj a ku kaka a tjaljaljak.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.

S.FORM: izua su kaka a tjavulu a uqaljai?
neka ku kaka a uqaljai.
izua mapida mun ita nukinacemkeljan?
S.TRANSL: How many people are in your family?

S.FORM: izua masepatj a men ita nia kinacemkeljan.
S.TRANSL: There are four of us in our family.

S.FORM: kitulutulu sun inu?
kitulutulu aken i Akaw.
tima timadju?
ku kama timadju.
anema sengsengan nua su kama?
S.TRANSL: 你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?

S.FORM: kincadr timadju.
tima azua timadju?
ku kaka tjavulung azua timadju.
izua sengsengan nua su kaka a tjavulung?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister have a job?

S.FORM: kipusengsengsengan timadju ita biyuing.
marakaka tiamadju a maljdrusa?
S.TRANSL: 他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?

S.FORM: ini, mareqali tiamadju.
kacalisiyan sun?
uii, se Payuan zuku aken.
kacalisiyan a su valjaw?
uii, ljakua se Drekai zuku timadju.
S.TRANSL: Yes, but she is a Drekai.

S.FORM: qacaqaca a su kama?
uii, qaqacaqacan amen a mapuljat a tacenkeljan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, we are all very tall.

S.FORM: kitulutulu anga a su kaka a vavayan a tjaljaljak?
S.TRANSL: Does your sister go to school?

S.FORM: uii, kitulutulu anga timadju.
saigu a qivu ta pinayuanan a marka su kaka a tjaljaljaljak tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: Do your siblings speak the language?

S.FORM: uii, saigu tiamadju a qivu ta pinayuanan a kai.
S.TRANSL: Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: izua mapida a mareka su kaka?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: izua matjelu amen a marekakakaka.
S.TRANSL: I have three brothers and sisters.

S.FORM: nakitevelj su ta su kama kata su kina?
S.TRANSL: 你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?

S.FORM: uii, nakitevelj a ken ta ku kama kata ku kina.
S.TRANSL: 是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.

S.FORM: a su vuvu a uqaljai a vavayan nakitevelj uta tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?

S.FORM: ini, inika ken a nakitevelj tjayamadju.
S.TRANSL: 不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: tima su kiniteveljan?
nakitevelj aken tjai kama, tjai kina, kata ku kaka a tjavulung a uqaljai.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.

S.FORM: kemasinu su a mangetjez?
kemasi Akaw aken a mangtjez.
inuan a nutapaw?
izua i Akaw a nia tapaw.
inua a nu qinaljan?
i Sisigu a nia qinaljan.
inu a nu qinaljan?
izua i Kasuga a nia qinaljan.
nu makudakuda a su sivaikan a sema qinaljan?
S.TRANSL: 你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: nu pulavalavai a i gakku tjara vaik ken a maumaq.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.

S.FORM: se paiwan aken a kakedriyan.
namakuda kinaqadavan tucu a qadaw?
cemdas anga a qadaw, maculju a ravac a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: The sun is coming out, it's very hot.

S.FORM: vucelelj a i casaw tucu?
S.TRANSL: Is it going to be cold outside?

S.FORM: vucelelj aravac, kavau a pakaliyaw.
S.TRANSL: It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: maculj aravac a i casaw?
ini, venali anga, vucele a kirimu.
namakuda kinakemudan nua kalevelevan?
ini a vucelelj a ravac, ini a maculju a ravac, sarunguanguaq a ravac.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: namakuda, kalevlevan tucu a vengin?
neka nu qerepus i kalevelevan, tjevutanga a vitjuqan.
S.TRANSL: 天空沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky; the stars came out.

S.FORM: namakuda kelevelevan i casaw?
tjaumeljai a qudjalj, cemdas anga a qadaw, minqut anga a quljivangeraw.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.

S.FORM: namakuda a kalevelevan izua i tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: What's the weather like where you are?

S.FORM: mezangal aravac a vali imaza i tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: We're going to have a big storm here.

S.FORM: namakuda a i tjanumun a kalevelevan?
bulai aravac, maqadaqadaw.
S.TRANSL: Very well, out of the big sun.

S.FORM: uri vaik anga ken a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: I have to go to school.

S.FORM: vucelelj a kalevalevan, kavau a pakaliyaw.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: uri vaik anga ken a casaw.
uri qemudjalj a paljeqaca nusauni, paqenetju anga kemacu tua kausua.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: uri qemudjalj?
napageleng anga tasauni, nusauni tjara qemudjalj.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj anga?
naqemudjalj tasauni, meljai anga tucu.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj anga?
matu naqemudjalj anga, tjevetjeveng a kadjalanan.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: naqemudjalj? a ku tjevetjeveng a su kinacavacavan?
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: qemudjaqudjalj anga a i casaw, ini kaken a nakemacu tua kausua.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: namakudanga sun?
qacavali ravac a vali, vecengel a ku qulu ta ku kinivalian.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: namakuda anga sun?
mezangal a qadaw, malingac aken ta ku kinipaqadavan.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.

S.FORM: namadraudrw aken a kemacu tua inpic.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: ku pasedjamai sun.
namadraudraw aken a kemacu ta ku qecap.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: inika ken a nakemacu uta, vaiki a veneli.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either, let’s go buy one.

S.FORM: bulai a vaik itjen a venli ta inpic?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: bulai, uri venli aken uta ta siulaulau.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: bulai a vaik itjen a venli ta tja kenamain?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?

S.FORM: ini, nakeman aken i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: No, I’ve already eaten at home.

S.FORM: namadraudraw aken a semljec tua ku bintu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to steam my lunchbox.

S.FORM: kirimu sau seljecu!
namadraudraw ken a kemacu tua ku bintu.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my lunchbox.

S.FORM: pai numayan tjakanau anga ku bintu!
S.TRANSL: 那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!

S.FORM: anem su kanen nu sikecengcengelj?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: uri keman aken ta cenglej nagakku.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.

S.FORM: anema su kanen nu sikecengcengelj?
S.TRANSL: What do you want to eat for lunch?

S.FORM: nakemacu aken tucu a qadaw ta bintu, tjakanau anga nu sikecengcengelj!
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!

S.FORM: bulai a vaik itjen a benulu ta lanciu?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go play basketball, shall we?

S.FORM: bulai! ari vaiki.
bulai a vaik itjen a benulu ta pangeciu?
ini, uri kitulu aken.
alapan aken tua suapan.
S.TRANSL: Please help me with the broom.

S.FORM: uii, kusipavayan aicu a suapan tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: alapan aken ta zuking uii?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: semuasuap aken, alapan aken ayau ti Kapi.
S.TRANSL: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Kapi to carry it for you.

S.FORM: makasuap anga sun?
makasuap anga ken.
aku inika sun a semuap?
makasuap anga ken.
kungakungai aravac a kasintan, sau zukingu anan.
S.TRANSL: The floor is dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: uii, vaik aken a malap ta zuking.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.

S.FORM: kungakungai aravac azua qezung, sau djuasi anan.
S.TRANSL: 那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: mayanan, inianan a ku pakasuap taimaza.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.

S.FORM: uri kemuda anga sun nusauni?
uri vaik aken a kemin ta sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: uri kemuda anga sun nuvaik anga sun i gakku?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: uri vaik aken a semnai katua ku qali.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: uri kemuda anga timadju nuvaik i gakku?
uri vaik timadju a ljemangui.
izua ti Kivi i tjumaq?
S.TRANSL: May I ask if Kivi is home?

S.FORM: itjumaq timadju, idu saqumaqanu.
S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: izua i tjumaq ti Vais?
neka timadju, anema nu sikim tjaimadju?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: tima aicu?
vuvu, ti Vais aken, suqeljevi.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Vais, please open the door.

S.FORM: timasun?
ti Api aken, kemim aken tjanusun a kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: Kacaw, I’m Api, I’ve come to play with you.

S.FORM: cuaicuai anga itjen a inika mecevung.
ui lja! nasingelit aken tjanusun. idu ka sudjusudjui lja!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我很想念你。快來聊天吧!
Yeah! I miss you so much. Come on, let’s chat!

S.FORM: qiladju, tekelu tua utja.
S.TRANSL: Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: masalu.
tekelu tua utja.
sanguaq angata a nu utja.
idu kani anga tua kudamunu!
uii, sa sanguaq aravac nutja pacunan aicu a kudamunu.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!這些水果看起來很棒。

S.FORM: sanguaq a kudamunu?
uii, sanguaq a paqulid.
makesa anga sinan kaiven ni kina, idu kani anga!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!

S.FORM: uii, vaik aken a pilima.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: suliyavu a kemen, nuka sun a qaliqali.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.

S.FORM: liyaw anga ravac aku kinan, mavedu aken aravac.
S.TRANSL: I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: su liyavu a keman, maya masiyaq.
bulay, sanguaq aravac.
uri vaik anga ken, ku kivalau anga nutjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.

S.FORM: uii, kanasuljivatju.
salilim anga, uri vaik anga ken a tjumaq.
pangdjezu anga mumalj nutjaivililj!
galju anga idjalan.
uii, nuizua su zikang kivalau anga a sema tjanuamen.
S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: bulabulay mun, tucu a qadaw uri kacuin mun nua sinsin a sema qinaljan a kivala tua ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Hello everyone, today I’m taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.

S.FORM: bulay yu! uri qivu amen tua kai a pinayuanan kata ramaljemaljeng.
S.TRANSL: 好喔!我們要跟耆老說排灣語。
Okay! We have to speak Paiwanese to the seniors.

S.FORM: uri djemaljun anga itjen?
uri djemaljun anga.
vuvu, mangetjengetjez amen a pacun tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: saigu mun a qivu ta pinayuanan a kai! aku kinananguaq!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說排灣語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: bulabulay mun, tucu a qadaw uri kacuin mun nua sinsi a semapuvaquan a karakuda.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，老師今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Hello everyone, today I will take you to work in the millet field.

S.FORM: uii, sinsi.
idu a mapuljat kasarisaringu, paqenetju a nunanemanemanga.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: uii, sinsi, nia inalap anga a penuljat a nia nemanema.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.

S.FORM: djemaljun anga itjen?
inianan a djemaljun, cemadjanan aravc.
S.TRANSL: Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: tisunai a lemalja ta zaljum.
uii, tiakenai a lemalja tazaljum.
tisunai a malap ta pakazazaw.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.

S.FORM: uii, tiaken a vaik a venilad taqayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: bulabulai mun a mapuljat, tucu a qadaw uri vaik itjen a sema puqemuzimuzipan.
S.TRANSL: 大家好，我們今天要去動物園。
Hello everyone, we are going to the zoo today.

S.FORM: kakubulai aravc! uri kemuda itjen a semazua?
S.TRANSL: 好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: paka basu itjen a vaik.
kasarisaringu a mapuljat, uri venli itjen tua kipu.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: uii.
a i tjaiqayaw pu qaqayaman, a i tjailikuz pu qatjuvian, pacunu a kisumadju.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: sinsi marekutj aken ta qatjuvi.
iniamakuda, sau pacunu numaya ta qayaqayam.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: ucevucevungi anga imaza nu itanga tukian/milingan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後回來集合。
We’ll be back in an hour.

S.FORM: uii, masalu sinsi.
anema su pinacunan tucu a qadaw?
napacu aken ta liyaw aravc a qatjuvi kata liyaw aravac a qaqayam.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.

S.FORM: kadjaljavu, uri vaik anga itjen.
S.TRANSL: Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: kaljavaw aken a palamu, mazeli anga ku kula.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.

S.FORM: bulay a vaik itjen a ljemangui?
bulay aravc, pai ari vaik!
tjuruvu aravac a caucau a ljemanguljanguy imaza.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: vacan azua izua, bulai a tjaljumaza itjen a ljemangui.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.

S.FORM: nakemuda su mangetjez?
nadjemavac aken a mangetjez.
anema su pinakavavavan a mangetjez?
S.TRANSL: What kind of car did you take?

S.FORM: natjevavaw aken ta basu a mangetjez.
uri kemuda su a vaik a sema kiukai?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to church?

S.FORM: uri pivavaven aken ni kama.
kemuda timadju a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: How does he usually go to school?

S.FORM: maka MRT timadju a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: anema pinakavavavan nua su vuvu a vaik a venli ta ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?

S.FORM: maka utubaiy timadju a vaik a venli ta ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.

S.FORM: kamuda sun a vaik a sema Lan-Yu?
S.TRANSL: How are you going to get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: uri maka varukur aken a sema Lan-Yu.
S.TRANSL: I want to take a boat to Lanyu.

S.FORM: uri kemuda timadju a vaik a sema Lan-Yu.
S.TRANSL: How did he get to Orchid Island?

S.FORM: uri maka hikuki timadju a sema Lan-Yu.
S.TRANSL: He took a plane to Orchid Island.

S.FORM: anema tjinvavavan nimadju a sema Takau?
S.TRANSL: What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?

S.FORM: namaka Kau-Tii/ HSR timadju a sema Takau.
S.TRANSL: He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.

S.FORM: nama ka kisia timadju a sema Taitung?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: uii, namaka kisia timadju a sema Taitung.
S.TRANSL: Yes, he took a train to Taitung.

S.FORM: namaka kisia timadju a sema Taitung?
S.TRANSL: Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ini, namaka hikuki timadju a sema Taitung.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.

S.FORM: izua ljaljevavavan tua basu imaza i dudut?
S.TRANSL: Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: izua, sevecu a vaik pasaqayaw ki sun a pacun tua ljaljevavavan ta basu.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.

S.FORM: a tjalja dudutan ta ljaljevavavan ta MRT izainuan?
S.TRANSL: 離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: neka imaza a ljaljevavavvan ta MRT, amin a makavavav ta haiya.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: nu makavavaw ta basu makudakuda a zikang sa djaljun i gakku?
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: nu 15 min a zikang kidjemaljun i gakku.
nu tjevavaw tua Kau-tii makudakuda a zikang sa djaljun i Tai-Ciu?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: ita tukian ki djemaljun i Tai-Ciu.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: cuai a zikang nu maka zitusiya a sema Ulai?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: tjra izua itazikang.
pida zikang nu tjevavaw sun ta MRT a sema tjanuamen?
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?

S.FORM: izua 20 min a zikang.
saigu sun a maka zidinsiya?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: saigu aken a maka zidinsiya.
izua su utubay?
izua ita a ku kutubay.
izua su utubay?
neka nu ku utubay.
maqati aken a kivadaq tjanusun?
maqati, kisalu aravc aken.
maqati aken a kivadaq tjanusun?
sikuda, inialiaw a ku kinljang.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: nu nakecengelj anga izua su zikang? saljinga ken tu vaik a kivala tjanusun a ki maqati?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: uii, ku kaljavau sun itjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: izua su zikang nutiyaw? sakivadaq aken tjanusun ta patjara tjaucikel nua se Payuan.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於排灣族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the Paiwan tribe.

S.FORM: uri vaik aken a sema vavua nu tiyaw, neka ken itjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 明天我要去山上，不在家喔。
I’m going to the mountains tomorrow, so I won’t be home.

S.FORM: kemljang sun aravac tua kakudanan nua se Payuan, sa kitulu aken tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對排灣族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Paiwan, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: ini a liyaw aravac aku kinljang, ljakua maqati aken a kipapuljat a temvela.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: maqati aken a pasasing? sikananguaqan a paqenetj aken nu vencik anga ken.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?這樣以後比較容易記錄。
Can I record the video? It will be easier to record in the future.

S.FORM: uii, inikamakud.
aki pida anga a su cavilj?
izua 98 anga a ken.
kakedriyan anan sun.
ini lja, ramaljeng anga ken.
kemasinu sun?
kemasi Kuabar aken.
a su valjaw se Payuan uta?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的太太也是排灣族人嗎?

S.FORM: ini, se Piniyumayan a caucau timadju.
anemanema nu kaiyan a su kinasaigu a qivu?
saigu aken a qivu tua kai a nase Payuan kata kai nua se Piniyumayan.
S.TRANSL: 我會說排灣語和卑南語。
I can speak Paiwan and Puyuma.

S.FORM: maleva aken a kivadaq tjanusun, pasemalavi amen, tua patjara sinanpalisi itua qemaljup?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: uii, ruqaljup aken kamaqacuvucuvung anan aken.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: masalu, bulai aravac a su tulu tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: paquliqulid angata a ku sinipasemalaw, tjaucikel a kemasisicuayan nua tja sevalitan.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: patjemaza a ku kivadaq. masalu aravac tua su pasemalaw.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: inikamakuda, patjatjaucikeli anga nutjaivililj.
ku vaikai anga, saljinga ken a lemangeda tua tjaliyaw a milimilingan nutjaivililj.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.

S.FORM: uii lja, galju anga i djalan.
bilabulai sun, anema a uri su velin?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: uri venli aken tu ita a kuppu.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a cup.

S.FORM: bulabulai sun, anema a uri su velin?
S.TRANSL: Hello, what are you looking for?

S.FORM: uri venli aken tu ita a tjalupung.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: uri venli aken tua kuppu, paveliveli mun?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?

S.FORM: izua, uri venli sun tu pida?
S.TRANSL: Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: paveliveli mun ta saviki?
neka, ini amen a paveliveli ta saviki.
S.TRANSL: No, we don’t sell betel nut.

S.FORM: uri venli aken ta padai.
pida cavu a uri su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many packs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pavai aken tu tjelu a cavuan.
uri venli aken ta vurasi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: makapaveli anga ta vurasi.
S.TRANSL: All the sweet potatoes are sold out.

S.FORM: uri venli aken tu tjanudrusa a abula.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two bottles of oil.

S.FORM: itanga a nia tjeza.
S.TRANSL: We only have one bottle left.

S.FORM: sau velian aken ta qecilu.
pida tjingtjing a uri su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pida tjingting a qecilu a uri su velin?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uri venli aken tu 2 kuking.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: uri venli aken tu drusa djaljeng a ngigi.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: izua tjelu a djaljeng imaza, nisunai anga a penuljat!
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: pida aicu a tacavu a padai?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: nu tacavu drusaitai.
drusa puluq sa ita a kinpiya, sandrusapuluq a kinpiya sakamaya.
masalu.
izua 95 a kinpiya imaza.
ku pazuljuay anan a venli, padjaljun tu 100 kinpiya.
S.TRANSL: I’ll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: 510 a kinpiya a penuljat.
paka 500 bulai?
pazangal anga aravc aicu, maqati a madjuluin a pagalju?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It’s too expensive, can you make it cheaper?

S.FORM: ini a maqati, madjulu anga ravac aicu.
S.TRANSL: 不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.

S.FORM: uri ku alapen aicu a tacavu a alju.
S.TRANSL: I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: 30 aicu a tacavu a alju, izua anan a zuma uri su veli?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?

S.FORM: maqati aken a kisedjam tua su ginpiya?
S.TRANSL: Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: maqati! pida su kinasaljinga?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: namadraudraw aken a masi ginpiya, maqadi aken a kisedjam tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: inika ken a nakemacu tua ginpiya uta!
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: namadraudraw aken a kemacu tua ginpiya, maqadi aken a kisedjam tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ini, katjaisangas a su kinisedjam tjanuaken a ginpiya inianan ka su pacikeli.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.

S.FORM: maqati aken a kisedjam tua su kava?
nanguaq, alapu a kisumadju.
maqadi aken a kisedjam tua su sapitj?
ku sinipasedjam anga tjai Tjinuay.
pasedjaman tjanuaken a su zidinsia uii?
S.TRANSL: 請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: uii, ljakua pacikelu nutiyaw tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: qemudjalj anga, inika ken a nakemacu tua kausua, maqati aken a su pasedjaman?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me one?

S.FORM: ita a ku kausua, pai kadjadjalain a kiljaung!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: aicu a ku kinisedjam tjanusun ka tjaisangas a sapitj, ku pacikelaw tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: nu sapacun anan sun ta anema a sapitj pasemalavi anga ken.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: numakudakuda a uri ku sipacikelan ta kinpiya tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: iniamakuda, nuizuanga su kimpiya qaqivuanga.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.

S.FORM: nungida uri semukiyam sun tjanuaken?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to pay me back?

S.FORM: ku su kiamai anga sun nutiyaw.
S.TRANSL: I will return it to you tomorrow.

S.FORM: nungida anga uri su pacikelen aku sapitj?
S.TRANSL: When are you going to return my book?

S.FORM: matu ku pinacikel anga ka tiyaw?
S.TRANSL: 我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: aicu a kinpic sinipasedjam ni Kuliw tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: Did Kuliw lend you this pen?

S.FORM: uii, ku kinisedjam tjaimadju tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: aicu a inpic su kinisedjam tjai Kuliw?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Kuliw?

S.FORM: ini, venli aicu ni kina.
S.TRANSL: No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: neka anga nu qatiya, sau kisedjamu tjai Umi.
S.TRANSL: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Umi.

S.FORM: uii, vaik aken a kisedjam.
sau qaqivu ti Umi tu pacikel ta kinisedjam a kinpiya tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Umi to give me back my money.

S.FORM: pida a kiyam tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: How much does she owe you?

S.FORM: uri sema inu sun?
uri vaik aken a sema puljacengan a temalem ta ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: kemudakuda sun?
pucemel anga ravac, semucemecemel aken, uri puzaljum anan nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: maqati sun a pusaladj tjanuaken a malap ta tjakit kata capelai?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?

S.FORM: su pininuan a tjemaula?
ku piniljaqedi ta kakarang.
S.TRANSL: Put it next to the plow rake.

S.FORM: su vinliqad anga a qipu?
S.TRANSL: Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: ku vinliqad anga qipu tasauni, uri tja tjugutan nusauni.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: maqati anga a tjakiljaceng a su talem a ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: maqati anga kiljacengen a kanran, azua ljaqacai inianan kamaqati a kiljacengen.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: waw! liyaw aravac a su kinivurasi.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.

S.FORM: maqati a su pusaladjan aken a pasa kubaw?
S.TRANSL: Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: anema nu kudakudain?
puaraarai amen tu djemameq ta ciqaw.
S.TRANSL: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: liyaw a ciqaw imaza?
liyaw angaravac a ciqaw i purur.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.

S.FORM: nuremaketjan su kudakudain nukiciqaw?
S.TRANSL: How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: avan a vuluq a ku sivuluq taciqaw.
S.TRANSL: I shoot fish with a spear.

S.FORM: saigu sun a penanaq a qemaljup?
S.TRANSL: Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: tjaliyaw a pudringai aken a qemaljup, nuremaketjan uta izua nu masi kuang masi vatu aken.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: pinakazuanan aicu nua vavui.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: aku su sikeljang?
aicu djukap nua vavui, pai aicu avan a djaladjalan nua vavui.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: ari kadjaljavi a vaik a pacun tua tja dringai, matu nadjemameq anga tua sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: a ku su sikeljang?
matu semqusequ anga a vatu, ari vaiki a kirimu.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.

S.FORM: anema su kasengsengsengen?
S.TRANSL: 你正在製作的是什麼東西?

S.FORM: aicu qezetj cu a pudringai, sidjamdjameq tua kulavaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.

S.FORM: anema azua su pinizua?
S.TRANSL: 你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: seluc tua kula azua dringai, avan a nia sidjamedjameq tua takec.
S.TRANSL: 那是套腳式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a leg-rigged rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: maleva itjen tapagaugaw nua naqemati, liayaw a tja djinameq a sacemel tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: uii lja! tjakacuaw a semaqinaljan satja kaqepuqepuan!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw uri temulu a ken tjanu itjen tu anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta qemuziquzip.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的排灣語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Paiwan language today.

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw uri temulu a ken tjanuitjen tu anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta cemel.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的排灣語怎麼說。

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw uri temulu a ken tjanuitjen tu anemaya ikai a sepaiwan ta kudamunu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的排灣語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Paiwan language today.

S.FORM: maya taqed.
maya ikai.
maya keman ta kakanen.
alapu ta su sapitj.
alapu ta su sivecivecik.
alapu ta su vaveciken.
ljenguaqu a sapitj.
ljenguaqu a sivecivecik.
ljenguaqu a kakanen.
ljenguaqu a vangavangan.
nima cu a sivecivecik?
nia ken cu.
nima cu a sapitj?
ni piya.
nima cu a siquliqulip?
ini aken a keljang.
ni piya a zua itung?
ini, ni aljuy cu a itung.
sinsi, neka nakemacu a ken ta sapitj.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: meseljangu a pacun katua su ljaqedi a salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: mapendruq anga ku sivecivecik.
sainipicu a venecik.
maulau anga ku siquliqulip.
ku si pasedjaman tja nu sun a ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: uri patjezua nga men ta kitulu, kipapaulingavu anga ta djalan nu sematjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: ui masalu sinsi.
uri patjezua anga tjen ta kitulu aiyanga mapuljat.
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，大家再見。
The class is over, goodbye everyone.

S.FORM: aiyanga sinsi.
nanguanguaq mun a mapuljat, ti piya a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is piya.

S.FORM: nanguanguaq sun piya.
djavadgavay a mapuljat, ti lulji a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is lulji.

S.FORM: nanguanguaq sun lulji.
nanguanguaq sun, ti piya ken.
nanguanguaq sun piya, ti kapi a ken.
nanguanguaq sun, ti lulji a ken.
nanguanguaq sun lulji, ti kapi a ken.
tima sun?
tiaken kina ni kuliw ti tjuku a ken.
tima sun?
tiaken kaka a tjaljaljak a vavayan, ni kuliw ti aljui a ku ngadan.
S.TRANSL: 我是kuliw的妹妹，我的名字是aljui。
I am kuliw’s sister. My name is aljui.

S.FORM: tima timadju?
ku sinsi timadju, ti sakinu timadju.
tima zua a caucau?
ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay timadju timadju ti camak.
ti piya timadju?
ui, ti piya timadju.
ui ti piya timadju
ini, ti kapi a ken.
tima ti kapi?
tia ken a ti kapi.
tima ti kapi?
ku qali ti kapi.
tima ngadan na su kaka tjavulung a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: ti muni a ngadan na ku kaka tjavulung a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is muni.

S.FORM: tima ngadan na su kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: ti vais a ngadan na ku kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is vais.

S.FORM: kemeljang sun ta ngadan nimadju?
ti piya timadju.
pida nga cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay tucu?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: tapuluq sa lima anga cavilj nimadju tucu.
pida nga cavilj na su kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljay tucu?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?

S.FORM: lima anga cavilj nimadju tucu.
izua gakku itua nu qinaljan?
S.TRANSL: Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: izua.
kitulutulu sun itua nu qinaljan a gakku?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: ui, nu i gakku amen a kitulutulu namaya men ta tacemekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: tima zua uqaljay?
ku kama timadju.
tima zua vavayan?
ku kaka tjavulung a vavayan timadju.
tima zua kakedriyan?
ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljay timadju.
anema sengsengan na su kina?
S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: hitai timadju.
anema sengsengan na su kama?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: sinsi timadju.
su kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljay timadju?
ini, na ku kaka tjaljaljak a uqaljay a qali timadju.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.

S.FORM: su kaka tjavulung a vavayan timadju?
ini, ku kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan timadju.
S.TRANSL: No, she is my younger sister.

S.FORM: mapida tiamadju a tacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: How many people in their family?

S.FORM: malje lima tiamadju a tacemekeljan.
S.TRANSL: There are five people in their family.

S.FORM: mapida a kakedriyan? ita nu kinacemekeljan
S.TRANSL: How many children in your family?

S.FORM: masepatj a men a kakedriyan.
S.TRANSL: There are four children in our family.

S.FORM: mapida su kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan kata uqaljai?
S.TRANSL: How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka nu ku kaka a tjaljaljak a uqaljay, izua matjelu a ku kaka tjaljaljak a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.

S.FORM: izua mapida su siruvetjek a uqaljay kata vavayan?
S.TRANSL: How many older siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay ata kaka a vavayan.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have any older siblings.

S.FORM: mapida su siruvetjek?
S.TRANSL: How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: neka ku siruvetjek.
mare kaka mun?
ui, ku kaka tjavulung a uqaljay timadju.
sekacalisian mun?
ui, sekacalisian a men.
sepaiwan zuku a caucau timadju uta?
ui, sepaiwan a caucau uta timadju.
S.TRANSL: 是的， 她也是排灣族人。

S.FORM: na makuda kinaqadavan tucu a qadaw?
na vucelelj a pagalju a kinaqadavan nu paka liyaw a temekel ta maculjuculju a zaljum.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: na makuda kinaqadavan tucu a qadaw?
maculju a pagalju a kinaqadavan nu paka liyaw a temekel ta zaljum.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: na makuda kinaqadavan i casaw?
maqadaw aravac a qadaw, paqenetju ta kiljaljaung.
S.TRANSL: The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: na makuda kinaqadavan i casaw?
liyaw a qerepus, neka nu qadaw i kalevelevan.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: nutiyaw namakuda a kadjunangan?
inika maqadaw nu tiyaw, liyaw a qerepus, qaca vali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.

S.FORM: na makuda kinaqadavan ta zua qadaw?
S.TRANSL: How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw, na vucelelj nu macasaw kavau a paka liyaw ta kava.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: na namakuda kinaqadavan nu kalja pulavayan?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: sarunguaq aravac a kinaqadavan nu kalja pulavayan.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.

S.FORM: uri qemudjlj nu tazua qadaw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: tazua bulay a kinaqadavan inika uri qemudjalj.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.

S.FORM: uri qemudjlj nu tazua qadaw?
S.TRANSL: Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: ui, tazua inika uri qemudjalj.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: tucu qemudjaqugjalj anga?
meljay anga, minqut anga qadaw.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: tucu? qemudjaqudjalj anga
qemudjalj anga, ini aken a na kemacu ta ljinay.
S.TRANSL: It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: qudjalj anga i casaw?
inika qemudjaqugjalj tucu nu pasuvililj tu cengelj, uri qemudjalj kacu anga ta ljinay nu macasaw.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: nu icavilj uri ljaljeqel nu kaljaljeqelan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: ui, nu icavilj uri vucelelj nu kaljaljeqelan kavau anga paka liyaw.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.

S.FORM: tucu a cavilj uri maculju nu kaljaculjuan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: ui, maculju aravac nu kaljaculjuan, tekelu anga paka liyaw ta zaljum.
S.TRANSL: 是，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: tjengelay sun ta kaljavuvuan?
tjengelay aken ta kaljavuvuan, sarunguaq aravac a kinaqadavan.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: tjengelay sun ta kaljauragan?
inika ken a tjengelay ta kaljauragan liyaw aravac a buhu nu kaljauragan.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.

S.FORM: madraudraw anga ken a kemacu ta sapitj.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the textbook.

S.FORM: kiseljang aken tjanu sun a pacun.
S.TRANSL: I will share it with you.

S.FORM: madraudraw anga ken a kemacu ta siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pasedjamai sun.
madraudraw anga sun a kemacu ta sivecivecik?
S.TRANSL: Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: paqulid, pasedjam aken ta su sivecivecik? maqati?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: anema su kanen ta sun cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?

S.FORM: uri keman a ken ta minpaw.
anema su kanen a kaiven?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for dinner?

S.FORM: uri keman aken ta kinsa.
anema su kinan a kenamain?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for breakfast?

S.FORM: na keman anga ken ta qecilu.
anema su kinan a cengelj?
S.TRANSL: What did you have for lunch?

S.FORM: na keman anga ken ta kuka.
vaik amen a tjemadrek ta bulu.
vaivaiku, ku karimau anga sun nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: 你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: vaik amen a ljemanguy.
nanguaq, kaciyuri anga vaik.
vaik amen a kivangavang ta bulu.
nakuya, vaiki a nan a men a semakuc ta sapitj.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.

S.FORM: na gemisagis anga sun ta aljis?
nekanan semenasenaw a ken ta tjapaq.
S.TRANSL: Not yet. I am doing the dishes.

S.FORM: na menurmur anga sun?
S.TRANSL: Did you rinse out your mouth?

S.FORM: na menuremur anga ken.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.

S.FORM: na semenaw anga sun ta tjapaq?
makasenaw anga ken ta tjapaq.
aku sun a inika na pilima?
S.TRANSL: Why didn’t you wash your hands?

S.FORM: nu sauni pilima nga ken.
S.TRANSL: I will wash my hands later.

S.FORM: kemudakuda sun ta sauni?
S.TRANSL: What were you doing just now?

S.FORM: na vaik a ken a karim ta sinsi.
S.TRANSL: I went to meet the teacher.

S.FORM: anema sun kudain nu patjezu i kakitulu?
S.TRANSL: What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: uri puarut a ken a tjumaq.
uri kemuda timadju nu pautez a kitulu?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?

S.FORM: uri vaik timadju a zemiyan.
S.TRANSL: She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: kivi, i tjumaq sun?
itjumaq kirimu. sa qumaqanu.
kivi, i tjumaq sun?
neka ti kivi! itjumaq ti muni aken izua anema kudain? ku kikai anga ti kivi. nu mangetjez
S.TRANSL: kivi不在家耶!我是muni，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告kivi。
kivi is not at home. I am muni. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: tima mun?
vuvu tiamen ti tjuku kati kivi pusaladji a men a semuqeljev ta paljing!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是tjuku和kivi，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are tjuku and kivi, please open the door for us.

S.FORM: tima a?
ti tjanubak a ken, mangetjez a ken a karim tjai camak.
S.TRANSL: I am tjanubak, I am here for camak.

S.FORM: vuvu mangetjez a ken a pacun tjanu sun.
S.TRANSL: Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: cuacuay anga su a inika mangedjez singelit aken aravac tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: kivi, mangetjez aken a karim tjanu sun ta kivangavang.
S.TRANSL: kivi, I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: kirimu saqumaqanun cuai anga ken a kaljava tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: aicu a vurasi ku sinitalem pai kilingavi a keman.
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: qaljemqem angata a icu a vurasi.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: idu samazaw! aicu ku sinitalem a kudamunu, kilingavi a keman.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: qaljemqem aravac a icu a kudamunu.
qiladju! ku sinitalem aicu a punug neka nu hiliu kilingavi a keman.
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: uwa! qaljemqem aravac aicu a punug.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: keman sun ta valjetjuk?
ini aken a maqatia a keman ta valjetjuk, bulai a keman aken ta linggu.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃蘋果就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.

S.FORM: keman sun ta pingkan?
nanguaq, tjengelay aken aravac.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I like it very much.

S.FORM: ku sitjuljakan tua kudamunu tu su kanen.
S.TRANSL: Let me peel the fruit for you.

S.FORM: masalu, liyaw a qetim na aicu a kudamunu.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This fruit is so juicy.

S.FORM: malap a ken ta zalujm tu ku sipatekel tjanusun sun.
S.TRANSL: I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: masalu.
suliavu a keman, na kemesa ken a pakaliyaw ta djamay.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: uwa! nguljingulj angata nu kanen sanguaq uta.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.

S.FORM: suliavu a keman, liyaw a nan a imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.

S.FORM: inia aken a masiyaq yu!
S.TRANSL: I’ll make myself at home then.

S.FORM: suliavu a keman, liyaw a nan a imaza.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: liyaw anga ku kinan, nakuya anga keman.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: uri kacuin mun a ma gadu ni sinsi tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: qivu ti kina liyaw aravac a cacarag i gadu aya.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: tucu a qadaw uri kacin mun ni sinsi a ma vavua.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: uri vaik a men a qemusul ta qipu?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: uri semainu itjen tucu a qadaw?
uri kacuin a men ni sinsi a sema pana.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: uri semainu itjen tucu qadaw?
uri kacuin a men a sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: uri vaik itjen a sema pana tucu qadaw?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: ini, uri kacuin itjen ni sinsi a sema gade.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.

S.FORM: uri vaik itjen a sema gadu tucu qadaw?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the mountains today?

S.FORM: ini, uri vaik itjen a sema vavua tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: sinsi, anema tja pacunan nu semapana itjen?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?

S.FORM: viak itjen a pacun ta qaqudruy.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinsi, uri sema gade tjen a pacun ta anema?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?

S.FORM: vaiki a pacun ta kalidrungudrungulj.
S.TRANSL: We are going to see butterflies.

S.FORM: anema tja kudain a semavavua?
S.TRANSL: What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: uri vaik amen a sema vavua pacun ta nia talem a punug, kipapaulingavu izua sasiq tjainan yu!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: sinis, uri sema pana tjen a ljemangui?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: ini, uri vaik itjen a pacun ta qaqudruy.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: sinis, uri mavavua tjen a temalem ta ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 老師我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?

S.FORM: uri vaik itjen tucu qadaw a temuvud ta qipu.
S.TRANSL: We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: inuan a qaqudrui a minlayalayap a pacacikecekel.
tucu a qadaw tjupacun aken ta paqulid a valjualjut a qaqudrui.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.

S.FORM: izua kalidrungudrungulj izua a minlayalayap.
yei! wa! tjengelay aken ta kalidrungudrungulj, bulay aravac.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶，很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.

S.FORM: izua kalidrungudrungulj izua a minlayalayap.
inika kalidrungudrungulj a zua, tjainan azua.
S.TRANSL: Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: imazau a pacun, nakuya macadja a ravac yu!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: nanguaq, inika cemadja a uri nia sazuain.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: maya mekelj galju a djemavac mavan nu setjakerus anga.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: saljinga ken a pacun a kirimu.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.

S.FORM: namaka tua anema sun a vaik a sema patjangzaq?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to the block-house?

S.FORM: na maka ta palidring a ken a sema patjangezaq.
na maka tua anema timadju a vaik a sema biuyeng?
S.TRANSL: How does he go to the hospital?

S.FORM: na djemavac timadju a vaik a sema biuyeng.
na maka ta anema sun a vaik a sema bukutu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: na maka ta hikuki a ken a vaik a sema bukutu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by plane.

S.FORM: na maka ta anema sun a vaik a sema bukutu?
S.TRANSL: How do you go to Penghu?

S.FORM: na maka varukur aken a sema pukutu.
S.TRANSL: I go to Penghu by boat.

S.FORM: na maka ta anema sun a sema tjumaq?
na maka ta tjeiyun a ken a sema tjumaq.
na maka tua anema ti tjuku a vaik a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: How does tjuku go to school?

S.FORM: na maka ta kisia ti tjuku a vaik a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: tjuku goes to school by train.

S.FORM: na maka ta anema ti piya a sema kiukay?
S.TRANSL: How does piya go to church?

S.FORM: na kizidinsia ti piya a sema kiukay.
S.TRANSL: piya goes to church by bicycle.

S.FORM: na maka ta tjeiyun sun a sema gakku?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by MRT?

S.FORM: ini, na maka basu a ken a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: No, I go to school by bus.

S.FORM: na kizidinsia sun a sema gaku?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to school by bicycle?

S.FORM: ui, na kizidinsia ken a sema gakku.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to school by bicycle.

S.FORM: na maka ta kautiy sun a sema takaw?
S.TRANSL: Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?

S.FORM: ui, na maka kauti aken a sema takaw.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: nu vaik sun a sema taitu maka hikuki sun manu maka kisiya sun?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: maka hikuki a ken, tjadjayaw a maka hikuki ta kisia.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: nu vaik sun a sema kiukay maka basu sun manu unting sun ta palidring?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: unting a ken ta palidring a sema kiukay tjananguaq a unting ta maka basu.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: dungdung a vavelian ta nu umaq?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: inika dungdung, kiutubay a ken a sema tua vavelian.
S.TRANSL: 不近，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.

S.FORM: idungdung ta gakku a yubing?
S.TRANSL: Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: idudud nu djemavac djemaljun.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: idudud ta sasekezan na basu a kakanan?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: nu casaw ta ljaljevavan ta basu sa djemavac tu gu pungkang djemaljun anga.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.

S.FORM: izua su lingau tucu a qadaw?
makuda?
salinga ken ta vaik a paljilji tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: izua ku sengsengan tucu a qadaw nu tjaivililj anga.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: sa izua su lingau nutiyaw? ku karimau anga sun nu na kincengelj anga.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: maqati ku kaljavau anga sun i tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: maqati aken a luing? saljinga ken ta pungengetj.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.

S.FORM: paqulid ui bulai.
maqati a paiga?
S.TRANSL: Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: sekulung aken ini kana maparimasudju a suku uta nakuya yu.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.

S.FORM: ku pasasingau numaya.
S.TRANSL: Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: kumalji a kipasasing masengac.
masalu na selaing sun a ku kivadaq.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: inika makuda anema uri su sikivadaq?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: ka maqacuvucuvung sun anema su kipusengsengan?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: taizing aken kasicuayan ljakua na kidjaula anga ken.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.

S.FORM: sa tucu izua su kipusengsenganan?
S.TRANSL: Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: i gakku aken a kipusengsengan.
i zuazua i qinaljan a su aljak uta?
S.TRANSL: 您的孩子也住在部落嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: ini izuazua i lizuk a kinaizuanan na ku aljak.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: macidicidilj sun ita su kinaizuanan?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: na paquzip aken uta ta ita vatu ita ngiyaw tiamadju ku cemekeljan uta.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: na paquzip aken uta tu ita ngiyaw nu izua qemuziquzip ini tjen a masepelj.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會無聊。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: kivadaq aken tjanusun ta pakata palisiyan na qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: kedri a ku kineljangan ljakua tjara temevela ken ta ku kineljang.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我能回答的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: anema palisiyan na zua nu siqaljuqaljup dugu?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的武器有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: inika maqati a matjapi ta vavayan a siqaljuqaljup a nemanga.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的武器不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: maqati a kiseljang a azua vavayan a qemaljup?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: nakuya kumalji a vavayan inika maqati a qemaljup.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: kuliw nekanga vava i tjumaq sau vaiku a veneli.
S.TRANSL: kuliw，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
kuliw, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: izuanan a tjanu ita vava i kakesan sikuda veneli!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: inika cengceng a tja nu ita vaikuanan a veneli tu tjanudrusa.
S.TRANSL: 一瓶不夠，再去買兩瓶回來。
One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: veneli aken ta vava paveliveli mun ini?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: izua pida su velin?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: veneli aken tu tja nu drusa katua tja nu ita a padai.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: imaza padai izuanan a su kinasaljinga?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: venelianan aken ta qecilu izua nimun?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?

S.FORM: makapaveli anga men ta qecilu.
uri veneli aken ta itung.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: na makuda su kinasaljinga?
S.TRANSL: What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: uri veneli aken ta rikirikitj a itung.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: bulai ini aicu a qudjidjilj?
izua maljiyan a quljaw?
izuanan a nia vucelacelai kata cangiangia.
S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: pavai aken ta cangiangia a kava.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: kuliw kasinu sun tasauni na vaik? sun a undu?
S.TRANSL: kuliw你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
kuliw, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: ini, na vaik aken a pusaladj tjai vuvu a veneli ta ljaceng.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: manukemuda izua su lingaw nu qezemetj maqati sun a kidjadjalan tja nu aken a keman.
S.TRANSL: 這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?要不要和我一起吃飯。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: ini, a maqati uri vaik aken a veneli ta itung.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.

S.FORM: kidjadjalan aken tja nu sun numaya.
S.TRANSL: Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: nanguanguaq sun pida valjitjuq na aicu a ljaceng?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: nu tadjaljengan drusa puluq.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.

S.FORM: pida valjitjuq ta aicu a vurasi?
S.TRANSL: How much are these sweet potatoes?

S.FORM: nu iking a vurasi tjelu a puluq.
S.TRANSL: Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: pavai aken tu drusa tadjaljengan a ljaceng iking a vurasi.
S.TRANSL: 請給我兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: kuliw maraurau aken a kemacu ta sivecivecik maqati sun a pasedjam tjanuaken?
S.TRANSL: kuliw，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
kuliw, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: neka nu niaken uta aicu ni kivi.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is kivi’s.

S.FORM: maqati a pasedjam tja nu aken a palamu djaljaw sa ku pacikeli.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: bulay alapu.
masalu pusalui anga ti kivi uta.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank kivi for me.

S.FORM: anema kinasaljinga?
uri pacikel aken taicu a drusa sapitj.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: bulai izuanan a anema?
S.TRANSL: No problem and what else do you need?

S.FORM: kisedjam anan aken taicu a tjelu a sapitj.
S.TRANSL: I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: bulai anga paqenetju nu tjelu a qadaw idu anga pacikel.
S.TRANSL: 好了。記得三天後要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: inika nan su a pacikeli a ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: ku pinacikel anga katiyaw.
aku nekanga ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: inika su sinipasedjam tjai piya.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to piya?

S.FORM: inika ken a kemeljang vaik aken a kivadaq tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: ku pasedjamai anan sun ta ku siquliqulip.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: kivi ni piya aicu a kava a sinipasedjam tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: kivi, did piya lend you this coat?

S.FORM: ini aicu vinele ni kina tjanuaken.
S.TRANSL: 不是，這是我媽媽買給我的。
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: a kava ni piya namaya ta su kava.
S.TRANSL: piya’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: qucengecengel a kava nimadju inika mamaw a nia quljau.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: kivi na kisedjam sun ta valjitjuq tjai piya?
S.TRANSL: kivi, did you borrow money from piya?

S.FORM: izua uri pacikel aken tucu a qadaw ljakua na marauraw a ken a kemacu ta valjitjuq.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.

S.FORM: semukiam sun nungida?
S.TRANSL: Then, when will you return the money?

S.FORM: nutiyaw ku sipacikel tjaimadju.
S.TRANSL: I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: bulai ku kikaianga ti piya.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell piya for you.

S.FORM: nu puringai ta kulavaw qezetjen ta qaciljai a ringay nu puringai ta tjikurai seman vetjun a semeluc ta ringai.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: manu namaitucu tiaken a pasaliw djaljepan inika ken a djemamedjameq.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: ku tuluai sun tu kemuda semanaya taicu a drusa ringai.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: bulai bulaiangata nu tjaivililj tjara madjameq a sacemel.
S.TRANSL: 好啊！太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: qaca anga cemel i vavua sau alapu ta tjakit a masuku vaiki a semavavua.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草太長了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: piniinu a tjakit?
i ljaqedi ta tjakaz nu ljetaladj sun ta suku su pacunan.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: kipapaulingavu ta malap nakuya mapasaqetju radjai a tjakit.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，不要受傷。鐮刀很利。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: maya djemulat a ku ringai!
inu a su ringai?
iteku ta kasiw a ku ringai.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: aku sun a paqenetj?
izua ku sinipukeljang imaza kemeljang aken tu inu aku ringai.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: aicu surunung tja pizuain i veleljuan tu sidjameq ta ciqaw.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚筌，我們放在溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: neka nu niamen a surunung panadip a nia sikiciqaciqaw.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: inianan aken a cekau ta panadip nu tjaivililj tului anga ken?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: bulai kaciyuri anga nu tjaivililj a panadip ta ciqaw.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: numaya nu tjaivililj ku tuluai anga sun tu kemuda semanaya ta surunung.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: garavagavagav anga su panadip manu izua nga ciqaw a na mapanadip rakacu a kirimu.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: mayanan mariqeriq aravac a varukur tjemaza ken a remakac ta panadip sazuau pusaladji aken a malap ta arai.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: rakacu a pasamaza i tja nu a ken ku pusaladja sun a remakac.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: bulai angata tucu na mapeljuq anga ciqaw i ta surungung.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: vaiki a kirimu a semiljeva ta tja salasaladj.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: mangtjez anga ti sinsi.
mayanga kivangavang, qiladju a kirimu tua sangel.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: pinaqaljayan, sekavililj anga en!
saqumaqanu a kirimu.
sikapidaqadaw tua singci tasauni?
sikalima qadaw tua singci tasauni, uri semekez nutiyaw, ari a kivangavang!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!

S.FORM: nanguaq lja! ari a sema pana.
S.TRANSL: Great! Let’s go to the riverside.

S.FORM: sikapidaqadaw tua singci nutiyaw?
S.TRANSL: What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: sikatjelulj a qadaw nutiyaw, ari vaiki anga nu pasuvililj tua cengelj a benuru!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!

S.FORM: uri anema su kudain nu tiyaw a kadjaman?
S.TRANSL: What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: niciyubi nutiyaw, uri sema kiukay amen kati kina.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: makuda sun?
sa mutjaq aen, uri sema kaya en.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: malingac aravac a u qulu.
kidjeljapau a kisulingac.
sinsi, saqetju a u tjiyalj, uri sema kaya en.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: nanguaq, vaiku a kirimu.
maqati aen a pilima?
S.TRANSL: May I go wash my hands?

S.FORM: palamu kisemekaz anga kitulu, vaiku anga nusauni.
S.TRANSL: It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: sinsi, marusaqetju a u qulu, uri cingciya sa sekez nu pasuvililj tua cengalj.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: nanguaq, kiljivaku nu tjumaqsun.
S.TRANSL: Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: uri cingciyaen nu tjavililj a singci i, sa vaik aen a kipucemel.
S.TRANSL: 老師我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: nanguaq, kitarivaku a sukinacavacavan.
inu ti Tjuku?
saqetju a tjiyalj nimadju, i kaya timadju.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: inu ti Kuliu?
sinsi, saqetju a liqu ni Kuliu, na cingciya tucu a qadaw.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Kuliu has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: akumaya inikana mangtjez ti Tjuku kasauni?
na maculju a kinacavacavan nimadju.
kitjumalju tjanusun a macidilj.
ti Sakinu aen a Tjuridri, tapuluq anga u cavilj tucu.
S.TRANSL: My name is Tjuridri, and I’m 10 years old.

S.FORM: tima su ngadan?
ti Kuliu a u ngadan.
anema nu zukuan sun a kakedriyan?
S.TRANSL: What ethnic group are you from?

S.FORM: sePaiwan aen a kakedriyan.
sekacalisiyan mun a tacekeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: uy, sePaiwan amen a tacaekeljan.
S.TRANSL: 是的，我們全家都是排灣族人。
Yes, my whole family is Paiwan.

S.FORM: sekacalisiyan a su tacemekeljan?
S.TRANSL: 你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ini, sePaiwana u kama, pairang a u kina.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是排灣族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Paiwan, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: nimasun a aljak?
ni Sakinu a Tjuridri aen a aljak.
S.TRANSL: I am Sakinu a Tjuridri’s child.

S.FORM: su kama zua caucau? pidanga cvavilj nimadju?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: unem anga puluq a cavilj nimadju.
su kama zua caucau? pidanga cavilj nimadju?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: malji, nia ramaljeng i qinaljan timadju, alu anga puluq a cavilj nimadju.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老，他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: pida nga cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay?
tapuluq saka alu anga cavili nimadju.
tjavulung tjanusun tu liyaw a cavilj na su kaka tjavulung a uqaljay?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: lima cavilj a sikatjavulung tjanuaen nimadju.
makudakuda su kinaqaca?
izua 140 kunghun a u kinaqaca.
sicuayan anga u ljinengljengan tjanusun, qadjawsun a na meqaca nga?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: uy lja, izua nga 130kunghun a u kinaqaca.
qadjawsun a mekudral anga?
neka ei, na pasaliu sun a pacun.
mariljay anga sun?
neka ei, mekudral anga en.
mekudral anga sun?
uy lja, izua 30 kungcin a u kinasdjelung tucu.
uri semainu sun?
uri karim aen tjaysinsi a ma pankungse.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.

S.FORM: Kuliu uri semainu sun?
uri vak a venric tua cemel timadju.
S.TRANSL: He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: inu ti Kuliu?
i ljaljanguyan timadju, uri kiseljavak tua malalumalj a ljemanguy timadju nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: inu ti Tjuku? uri kiseljavak tua malalumalj a mintuluq timadju nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: Tjuku在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Tjuku? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: izua i litang timadju, u vikau a qemaqivu.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.

S.FORM: ari vaiki a sema caucang dri!
S.TRANSL: Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: vaik anan aen a venli tua cengelj, u su karimau anga nu sauni.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.

S.FORM: ari vaiki a qemalu tua piyentang dri!
S.TRANSL: Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: karimu tua zuma caucau, uri karim aen tua sinsi.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Kuliu uri malalumalj tua cemugecug tua buru nusauni?
S.TRANSL: Is Kuliu competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: neka ei, uri kiseljavak timadju tua malalulamalj a mintjuljuk.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: nu ita undukay a qadaw uri kiseljavak sun tua malalumalj?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: uy ei, uri kiseljavak aen tua malalumalj a mintuluq.
nu ita undukay a qadaw uri kiseljavak sun tua malalumalj?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri kiseljavak aen a cemugecug tua buru.
anema uri tjakudain ita malalumalj tua undu a qadaw?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?

S.FORM: uri malalumalj amen a mavaviljvilj tua calis .
S.TRANSL: We will compete in tug of war.

S.FORM: uri pavelitjen tua kakanen nu malalumalj a qadaw?
S.TRANSL: 我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?

S.FORM: malji, uri pavelitjen tua djapedjapesen.
na malap sun tua sangasangasan a nadan ei, maru qizing sun lja!
S.TRANSL: 你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!

S.FORM: masalu.
i tjumaq ti vuvu a vavayan?
izua, na taqed i qumaqan.
S.TRANSL: Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: i tjumaq ti vuvu a vavayan?
neka i tjumq, tjauvaik a sasaw nu qzemetj ki tjumaq.
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: i tjumaq ti vuvu a uqaljay?
ita tjayvavau a kinayzuan, savavavu a karim timdju.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: izua cacau i tjumaq ？
a, ti Kuliu lja, sicuyan anga ljinengeljengan tjanusun, nanguanguaq sun?
S.TRANSL: 是Kuliu阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s Kuliu. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?

S.FORM: nanguanguaq aen lja! mangtjez aen tu makakay tjanusun.
S.TRANSL: I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: inuan ti tjama?
cemalcala tua djamay i kakesan timadju, u vaikau a qemaqivu.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.

S.FORM: mainu anga ti Tjuku?
na vaik a sema pudjurikukuan a djemameq tua djurikuku.
S.TRANSL: She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: vuvu uqaljay, mangtjez anga men.
neka i tjumaq a nu vuvu a uqaljay, i kavuavuan timadju, kaljavau i tjumaq timdju dri!
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.

S.FORM: mangtjez anga sun ama i Kuliu dri!
cuacuay anga ljinengeljengan tjanusun, na meqaca nga sun.
S.TRANSL: I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: pacunan sun a mangtjez, maru maleva en. 。
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.

S.FORM: u sinipavay cu a pangudralj tjanumun, pasa pinsiang ngu!
S.TRANSL: 這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: sicuayan anga su pinangtjezan, u qaivuau a mapuljat tu mangtjez a keman.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: saldji tu pukakudan, temkel aen tua uciya, ari a matua papasedjaluan a makakay.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: masalu tua su pinasedjaluan, uri tjumaq anga en.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: tjauculjuin cu a djurikuku, kacu a tjumaq sa galjuyanga keman.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: maqati tu mecevung itjen ita pasuvililj tua cengelj nutiyaw?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: maqati, kaljavari tu maccevung itjen inuan?
maqati tu tjigaku iten? uri tja sansasingen.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: nanguaq a sema kakaqepuan, uri kemava en tua kinacalisiyan a itung.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: bulay aravac nu pautez a temelak a vuciyar nua sakura itua niya qinqljan. nu venutilak anga vuciyar idu anga karim tjanuaen.
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的櫻花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: uri kemaljava itjen a patje kaljavevuan, pasu gemalju anga ravac!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到春天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?

S.FORM: sa pangtjezu anga ita palisiyan nua masalut a qadaw!
S.TRANSL: 那你豐年祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Harvest Festival!

S.FORM: nanguaq lja! na kikaljava en!
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: u su kivadaqay tu’ “akumaya sa cemikel sun a sema qinaljan a kemayzua?’’
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?

S.FORM: uri cemikel aen a temulu.
S.TRANSL: I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: akumaya ikasun a temulu i lizuk?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: ayatua veleqed en tua u qinaljan, na saljinga en uta tu pasucikel a qemeljing ta i qinaljan uta.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: saigu sun aravac a tjemenun, tima na temulu tjanusun?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: avan a u vuvu a vavayan. tjaljasaiguan a tjemenun i qinaljan timadju.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: nakemuda sa venerung sun a kicaquan ta tjemenun?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: nia kakudan a tjemenun, na sa patudur aen tua nia kakudan.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.

S.FORM: sanguaq ngata tja tekelen aicu a vinava vaqu.
u vinava a macidilj lja！
maru saigu sun angata, cuacuay itjen a venava?
S.TRANSL: 你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ikacuacuay, tjara izua pitju a qadaw mavava nga. tja pakakesain anan a pita lalidringan avaqu, sa pizuay tua djulis a kemadikat, maqati anga djilungen.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: anema su sipaveliveli?
izua kamangulj katua ljaugiyu, tiyaen a na temalem a macidilj lja!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: pida valjitjuq nu velin a ljemedrusa?
drusaiday sa limapuluq a valjitjuq a penuljat.
tjenglay aen tucu a itung, pidapaisuan a veli?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?

S.FORM: limaiday a valjitjuq a veli nucu a itung.
pazangal aravac, maqati tu tjamadjulu a pagalju?
S.TRANSL: It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: inikamaqati, nu pitjamadjulu uri masipun aen.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: uynumaya! numaya venli aen tu taitungan tua qecengecengel a itung.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.

S.FORM: na saljinga en taicu a tjakit katua pariyuk.
S.TRANSL: 我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: drusa kuzuljan a valjituq a veli a penuljat. u sinaliman a malang, tjaramaqati a siseljudj a cuacuay.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: u tjumaljay a u qaliyaliyan tu veneli, maqti tu tjamadjulu anan?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?

S.FORM: nanguaq lja! u supuaw tu 8ce anga.
S.TRANSL: Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: pangtezu a pacun lja! izua itung katua tjalupung a sipaveliveli.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: pidapida veli nua itung?
nu ita itung tjelu a iday sa limapuluq a valjitjuq, nu tjelu a itung kuzulj a valjitjuq a veli.
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: veneli aen tu ita sakamaya, pavay aen tua vaquan.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: nanguanguaq sun, na saveneli aen tua djuadjuay a tjinaljak katua ljinivanger a qalum.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: sepaveli anga penuljat a tjinaljek, izuanan a u tjinanaq a yuping, veneli sun?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: nanguaq dri! pavay aen tu masanita, veneli anga en nu tjayvililj tua tjinaljek.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: nanguaq, u ravavaw tua lubulubuk, nu maytazua limapuluq a valjitjuq.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
